spacegame

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • spacegame.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game class sets the game background and creates a local player on that background. It contains all the elements for running a network client for this specific multiplayer game. The game class is mainly used to run the graphic contents of this game, as well as input from local player, which is then forwarded to the client. At the moment it only works when connected to a server, since, for example bullets are spawned by the server.
    Since:
    2015-01-15
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Simon Borgström

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String ip,
            java.lang.String userName,
            double posx,
            double posy)
        Constructs a Game instance. This is the only way to start the game. Requires an ip adress to with the client will be connected, an username for the player and a starting position of said player represented by the posx and posy values.
        Parameters:
        ip - - The IP-address to which the client are to connect
        userName - - The username of the player
        posx - - the X coordinate of the players start position
        posy - - the Y coordinate of the players start position

    • Method Detail

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(PlayerMP player2)
        Adds a player to the game. This could be used by the client to add a player connected to the server or used by the local player to get added in the game.
        Parameters:
        player2 - - the PlayerMP to be connected

      • damage

        public void damage(PlayerMP player,
                   int damage)
        Notifies the server that this player has hit another connected player
        Parameters:
        player - - The player who has been damaged
        damage - - The amount of damage the player takes

      • damagePlayer

        public void damagePlayer(java.lang.String username,
                         int damage)
        Notifies the local player if another player has been hit and adjusts that players hit points and graphics accordingly.
        Parameters:
        username - - The connected player that has been hit
        damage - - The amount of damage the player takes

      • getPlayerArray

        public java.util.ArrayList<PlayerMP> getPlayerArray()
        A synchronized instance of the ArrayList of connected players
        Returns:
        -The ArrayList of connected PlayerMP

      • getRootPlayer

        public int getRootPlayer(java.lang.String username)
        Finds the graphics of a PlayerMP added to the games Pane
        Parameters:
        username - - the PlayerMP to be found
        Returns:
        - The Panes added children index of the wanted player

      • removePlayerMP

        public void removePlayerMP(java.lang.String username)
        Removes a player from the game
        Parameters:
        username - - The username of the player who are to be removed

      • runGame

        public void runGame(javafx.stage.Stage primary)
        Instantiates the game. Takes a stage on which to setup the game.
        Parameters:
        primary - - the Stage on which to setup the game

      • updatePlayers

        public void updatePlayers(java.lang.String userName,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double rotate)
        Update the connected players position as mandated by the game server
        Parameters:
        userName - - The connected PlayerMP to be moved
        x - - Sets the players TranslateX
        y - - Sets the players TranslateY
        rotate - - Sets the players Rotate

      • updateShoots

        public void updateShoots(double x,
                         double y,
                         double rotate)
        Creates a bullet instance to be added to the game. The bullet spawns when the server communicates to the client that a connected player has fired a shot.
        Parameters:
        x - - The bullets TranslateX position
        y - - The bullets TranslateY position
        rotate - - The bullets rotation
